about_text: I'm a recent graduate from BCIT (British Columbia Institute of Technology). I received my diploma in Computer Systems Technology which is a 2 year condensed diploma program. My studies consisted of Software Development, Computer Science, and Algorithms. Currently, I am seeking a job and open to opportunities.
I have experience building mobile apps, websites, servers, and even IOT devices. I thoroughly enjoy solving problems and getting down to the nitty gritty while coding.

One of the most magical, wonderful, brilliant, and favorite feelings in the world is when I enter my flow state. I always seek to enter the state of mind where I can program or do anything for hours and hours and forget about the world around me.

On top of problem solving, I love building and designing things!  I do this not only through coding, but through exploring and creating new recipes, building games on Minecraft, and assembling Lego! I want to create things that bring a smile to peoples faces in addition to making life easier (through ways such as automating repetitive tasks, creating simple UIâ€™s that are easy to follow, etc).

During my time at BCIT, I have attended various hackathons, and was involved in BCIT Coding 4 All. Hackathons were amazing because it allowed me to explore and create whatever I wanted outside of school (as well as increasing my sticker collection). My involvement in Coding 4 all was tutoring first semester programming students and doing presentations on web development and algorithms!

website.name: Personal Website
website.Notable Achievement: I'm just fascinated at how brilliant and efficient React is vs vanilla javascript

f4x4x4.name: 4x4x4 Tic Tac Toe
f4x4x4.description: A 3D 4x4x4 tic tac toe game created by Three.JS, Javascript. Contains three game modes with a simple AI to play alone!

BeatDapp.name: Internal Team Building Tool
BeatDapp.description: Internal Team building tool that uses SQL

LightUp.name: LightUp
LightUp.description: Light-UP detects facial emotions with machine learning and uses colours and light patterns to help improve your mood and light up your day!
LightUp.Notable Achievements: Best use of Google Cloud Platform - (Google Home Mini for Each Member)

SpeakOn.name: SpeakON
SpeakOn.description: A customizable augmented communication application to allow tailored and languages between caregivers and children diagnosed anywhere on the autism spectrum.
SpeakOn.Notable Achievements: Top 10 - Yearly Subscription to Wolfram Alpha

NightLight.name: Night Light
NightLight.description: Android application that calculates the brightest path between your location and the current location you want to go to. Application does this by counting the number of lights within a path. My roles included developing the backend, zooming, finding the # of lamps per path, and the logic to determine what path is the brightest.
NightLight.NotableAchievements: Showcased our project to the city of Vancouver and placed 1st place out of 12 projects in the category of Security.

EcoQuest.description: A fun and interactive Phaser.js game that utilizes socket.io to create a multiplayer flashcard game. We used HTML, Javascript, MongoDB, Phaser.js, and CSS to create a visually appealing game to raise awareness of global warming. My roles include creating the game prototype with multiplayer and styling.
